subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: get your news in QS!
msgSnippet: ... Right.  Essentially all Americans merge LOT = PALM and THOUGHT = CLOTH, as well as TRAP = BATH, ENEs being the exception. BTW, where do I find this
messageBody:
Paul Tremblay scripsit:

> > If you open the actual CMU text file and look up the lexical set names
> > PALM (which uses symbol AA), LOT (AA), THOUGHT(AO) and CLOTH (AO) the
> > CMU merger is quite clear

Right. Essentially all Americans merge LOT = PALM and THOUGHT = CLOTH,
as well as TRAP = BATH, ENEs being the exception.

BTW, where do I find this dictionary?

> Yes, which I don't know if that represents a problem or not. I don't
> pronounce the "h," but spelling that way may look odd to others.

The only remaining strongholds of Why are the American South and
Scotland. (I know one fella from Virginia whose name is Whitlock,
and who claims he refuses to answer to "Witlock".)

> Another example is wind, which can mean what blows or what you do to an
> old fashioned clock. I have this as wind|wFnd in my private dictionary.
> I have to correct the word after a transliteration, which I can't do for
> the news. So we will have to tolerate some mistakes in the news, at
> least for now.

It's no worse than the incident where a Polish-American newspaper translated
a report that 10,000 telephone poles had been knocked down by a major
storm using the Polish word for "Poles" instead of "poles".

--
You let them out again, Old Man Willow! John Cowan
What you be a-thinking of? You should not be waking! cowan@...
Eat earth! Dig deep! Drink water! Go to sleep!
Bombadil is talking. http://ccil.org/~cowan
